Quadrantid Meteor Shower 2025: When, Where And How To Watch The Year's First Shooting Stars In India - Times Now
summary:
Quadrantid Meteor Shower 2025: When, Where And How To Watch The Year's First Shooting Stars In India

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

As 2025 rolls in, skywatchers will witness another dazzling shower, the Quadrantids meteor shower, lighting up the night sky. This annual spectacle of bright, colourful fireballs is known to be one of the most spectacular meteor showers of the year.

  • The Quadrantid meteor shower is active from December 26, 2024, to January 16, 2025.
  • The peak occurs on January 4, 2025, with up to 120 meteors per hour.
  • Best viewing in India is from the night of January 3 to early January 4, with peak intensity around 11:15 PM IST.
  • Ideal viewing locations are remote areas with minimal light pollution.
  • Meteors are best viewed lying on your back, facing northeast.
‚ÄúThe meteors are characterised by bright streaks of light flashing across the sky with a bang.‚Äù

This year‚Äôs Quadrantid meteor shower promises an unforgettable experience for skywatchers, particularly in India where viewers should prepare in remote spots for optimal viewing conditions.
newTitle: Quadrantid Meteor Shower 2025: Viewing Tips and Details for India

title: Is HMPV another Covid-19-like scare in China? What we know so far - Business Standard
summary:
China Faces Outbreak of Human Metapneumovirus (HMPV) Amidst Respiratory Illness Surge

Publication Date: December 2023 | Source: Reuters

China is experiencing an outbreak of human metapneumovirus (HMPV), raising concerns as hospitals report being overwhelmed. This outbreak follows a period of reduced exposure to common viruses due to strict COVID-19 measures.

The outbreak primarily impacts vulnerable populations including young children and the elderly. Experts point to the return of normal activities and colder weather as contributing factors.

  • The Chinese government has not issued an official warning despite the surge in cases.
  • Respiratory illnesses similar to flu symptoms are on the rise.
  • Proactive measures are being implemented by health authorities to monitor rising cases of pneumonia.
  • This year's total respiratory infection cases are expected to be lower than in 2024.
‚ÄúChina is likely to face an uptick in respiratory diseases throughout the winter and spring.‚Äù ‚Äì Kan Biao, NCDPA Official

Experts stress the importance of vigilance in monitoring respiratory illnesses as the country navigates the ongoing public health challenges posed by HMPV and other respiratory pathogens.
newTitle: China Faces Outbreak of Human Metapneumovirus (HMPV) Amidst Respiratory Illness Surge

title: China faces Covid-like scare again: All you should know about HMPV & other viruses overwhelming hospitals - The Economic Times
summary:
China Faces Covid-like Scare Again: All You Should Know About HMPV & Other Viruses Overwhelming Hospitals

Publication Date: Not specified
Source: Not specified

China is currently experiencing a surge of respiratory illnesses, particularly human metapneumovirus (HMPV), with reports indicating overwhelmed hospitals and health facilities.

The increase in respiratory infections is causing significant concern due to the potential strain on healthcare resources.

  • HMPV, Influenza A, Mycoplasma pneumoniae, and Covid-19 are rapidly spreading.
  • Reports suggest a possible state of emergency due to the surge in cases.
  • Children's hospitals are particularly affected by rising cases of pneumonia.
  • China's disease control authority is implementing monitoring systems for respiratory infections.
  • The infections are primarily affecting individuals under 14 in northern provinces.
China is facing a surge in multiple viruses, overwhelming hospitals and crematoriums.

This rise in cases emphasizes the need for public health awareness and preventive measures as officials predict a continued increase in respiratory infections.
newTitle: China Faces Scare from Rising Respiratory Viruses, Including HMPV

  • Passengers are advised to contact their airlines for updates on flight statuses.
  • SpiceJet has alerted passengers about potential flight disruptions due to bad weather.
  • Train services are also affected with at least 24 trains running late across North India.
  • Schools in Noida to be closed for classes up to 8 due to the cold wave.
